p: The following components have been isolated from the epicarp of G. brasiliensis fruit: a new glycosylated biflavonone, morelloflavone-4′′′- O-β- d-glycosyl ( 16), and the known compounds 1,3,6,7-tetrahydroxyxanthone (norathyriol; 17), morelloflavone (fukugetin; 9), and morelloflavone-7′′- O-β- d-glycosyl (fukugesid; 18). These compounds presented antioxidant activity after the isolation of natural biflavonoids from the plant [ 41].
